message.content:
We start from the “Cash deposit” row to set the beginning cash (our “cash‐on‐hand” balance), then “simulate” all transactions that affect cash – that is, every row whose “payment_method” (or “receive_method” if a sale is immediately collected in cash) is “Cash” (or “Cash deposit” or “Paid” using cash) – subtracting out cash–payments (for expenses, purchases paid by cash) and adding cash–inflows (sales paid in cash). (Many transactions – for purchases paid by bank transfer or recorded as “Account Receivable” – are not “cash on hand” movements.)

For example, in our new problem the very first row (for “Cash deposit”) gives an initial cash of 3,000,000.00. (The “Bank deposit” and “Fixed Assets” lines do not count toward “cash on hand.”)

Then, going row‐by‐row we only “affect” the cash account when the “payment_method” is “Cash” (and if a sale is collected by “Cash”). For example, the “Expense20240101001” for Sales Expenses of 12,654.40 paid by Cash is subtracted. Next “Expense20240102001” (4,436.41 in cash out) is subtracted; then later “Expense20240103001” (6,868.64 in cash out) is subtracted; and so on.

After “simulating” every cash transaction from row 4 all the way to the very last entry (see the detailed running‐total below), the final cash balance comes out to be 3,056,370.78.

A brief (illustrative) running total calculation is shown below:
 • Start with initial cash = 3,000,000.00 
 • Row 4 (Expense by Cash: –12,654.40) gives 2,987,345.60 
 • Row 9 (Expense by Cash: –4,436.41) brings it to 2,982,909.19 
 • Row 14 (Expense –6,868.64) → 2,976,040.55 
 • … (all cash–based transactions are summed one after the other) 
 • Finally, after including the last cash movement (an Administrative Expense on 2024‑02‑05 for –18,051.31), the ending total is 3,056,370.78.

Thus, the “cash on hand” shown on the balance sheet has an initial value of 3,000,000.00 and an ending cash on hand of 3,056,370.78.

The answer in the requested JSON format is:

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {'Cash on Hand Initial Value': '3000000.00', 'Cash on Hand End Value': '3056370.78'} }
